tool.name: GEEAuth

param.name: project_id
param.displayname: Specify the Google Cloud project ID for Earth Engine
param.dialogReference: Provide the Google Cloud Project ID in string format, for example, project-earth-374600

param.name: workload_tag
param.dialogReference:
Workload tags are labels for monitoring specific computations within Earth Engine. The user can monitor and track tagged computations in the Metrics Explorer using the Earth Engine Cloud Project > Project > Used EECUs metric, and grouping or filtering by workload_tag. Visit this link for more information: https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/monitoring_usage

Workload tag must be 1 - 63 characters, beginning and ending with an alphanumeric character ([a-z0-9A-Z]) with dashes (-), underscores (_), dots (.), and alpha numerics between, or an empty string to reset the default back to none.

tool.summary:
This script authenticates the use of Google Earth Engine with provided Google account. The project ID and workload tag are optional inputs here. The user can define them in the "Initialize Earth Engine" script later. To use Earth Engine, you'll need access to a Cloud project that:

  1. has the Earth Engine API enabled,

  2. is registered for commercial or noncommercial use, and

  3. grants you (or the user) the correct roles and permissions.

For more information, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/guides/access
